The proposed inference "The quimble might be groobled" only includes one of those predicates, "groobled". 

In propositional logic, if a statement in the form "A and B" is true, then we can validly infer that either "A" is true or "B" is true individually. This is because for "A and B" to be true, both "A" and "B" must be true.
